name: The Ruined Abbey of St Clewyd
tagline: Sighing wind seems to emanate from face-like formations in the sides of ragged granite peaks.

procedural.encounter_notes: Encounters are 2-in-6 likely to be with the gloam (DMB) that lairs in the abbey ruins

description: Close to where Swinney Road crosses the turreted Cantilope Bridge, a cobblestoned avenue diverges. Overgrown and flanked with defaced saintly statues, it leads to the shattered gate of the ruined abbey complex.

points_of_interest.name: The Ruined Abbey of St Clewyd
points_of_interest.description: A ruined abbey complex with chaotic phenomena manifesting among the ruins: prismatic, spectral flames; iridescent lights drifting and bobbing; erratic booming from underground; twitching ears and whispering mouths sprouting from stone.
points_of_interest.interior: The abbey complex contains a haunted bell tower, Chapel of St Clewyd, and disturbed graveyard. Extensive crypts extend beneath the chapel.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: A gloam called Mister Rag-n-Bone dwells in the bell tower with three charmed children. The western crypts house 50 monks (20 living, 30 undead) of the Order of Wardens.
special_features: Ley line Lamm - Arcane spell-casters feel observed by a pitiless malevolence
Holy magic sustains monks and resurrects the dead
secrets: The 'Charge' - a wretched monstrosity formed of the amalgamation of St Clewyd and Sallowbryg is imprisoned in the crypts

points_of_interest.name: Haunted Bell Tower
points_of_interest.description: A tall, square tower stands largely undamaged, close to the toppled gate. Dark birds roost in the belfry at the tower's summit. A gloam haunts this place, dwelling with three charmed children.
points_of_interest.interior: Ground floor: A decaying chapel dedicated to St Woad, patron of bakers, bears, and hammersmiths. 1st floor: The home of the three charmed children. 2nd floor: Macabre dioramas of stuffed woodland creatures with human teeth. 3rd floor: Belfry with great bronze bell and the gloam.
points_of_interest.exploring: Disturbing the figures on the 2nd floor risks the wrath of the gloam that lurks in the belfry.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Mister Rag-n-Bone (gloam) and three charmed children
special_features: Great bronze bell worth 1,500gp on 3rd floor

points_of_interest.name: Chapel of St Clewyd
points_of_interest.description: The main chapel is damaged but largely intact. A tapestry of climbing plants conceals a series of mosaics depicting the life and deeds of St Clewyd. Twin staircases descend to the chapel's crypts.
points_of_interest.interior: Contains mosaics of St Clewyd's life hidden behind climbing plants. Twin staircases lead to extensive crypts below.
special_features: Hidden mosaics depicting St Clewyd's life and deeds

points_of_interest.name: Disturbed Graveyard
points_of_interest.description: The graves of several hundred monks, surrounded by buckling, ivy-covered walls. The newest graves bear dates just over 100 years ago. Many have been carelessly dug up.
points_of_interest.interior: 2-in-6 chance of a charmed child being present here, digging.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Occasionally one of the charmed children digging for teeth
special_features: Many graves dug up for teeth

points_of_interest.name: The Chapel Crypts
points_of_interest.description: An extensive series of tombs and catacombs extends beneath the chapel. The doors from the surface lead into a vast undercroft in the eastern half of the crypts.
points_of_interest.entering: Twin staircases descend from the chapel above
points_of_interest.interior: Eastern crypts are wracked with Chaotic energies and monsters from a dimensional rift. Western crypts house the Order of Wardens - 50 monks (20 living, 30 undead) who have magically walled themselves in.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Order of Wardens monks, chaotic monsters in eastern section, the imprisoned 'Charge'
special_features: Holy magic provides sustenance and resurrection
The 'Charge' - amalgamated monstrosity of St Clewyd and Sallowbryg
secrets: The monks have sworn to remain until their 'Charge' can be healed
Holy magic sometimes misfires, creating mindless undead

npcs.name: Mister Rag-n-Bone
npcs.title: Gloam
npcs.description: Flock form: A swirling, noisome gyre of shrieking, decayed crows. Humanoid form: A gangly, pulsing agglomeration of tiny, broken bones, wearing a cloak of rancid feathers.
npcs.speech: Grating whisper, clacking of beaks. Woldish.
desires: Obsessed with creating taxidermied animals with the teeth of the devoutly religious dug up by the children in the abbey graveyard carefully sewn into their jaws
Protect and nurture the foster children

npcs.name: Bilbry Worms
npcs.description: A waif-like, blonde boy of 5 years.
desires: Digging up teeth from the graveyard for Mister Rag-n-Bone

npcs.name: Willy Hodgeheg
npcs.description: A strapping lad of 8 years, whose matted black hair cascades over his glowering eyes.
desires: Digging up teeth from the graveyard for Mister Rag-n-Bone

npcs.name: Violet Harrowmoor
npcs.description: A dark-haired girl of 6 whose dress and speech betray her aristocratic originsâ€”she is the missing daughter of Lady Harrowmoor.
desires: Digging up teeth from the graveyard for Mister Rag-n-Bone
secrets: The gloam charmed her away from behind her mother's back on a visit to the fortifications at Prigwort

items.name: Great Bronze Bell
items.description: A great bronze bell in the belfry

secrets: The abbey was destroyed by a ritual that created a dimensional rift
The 'Charge' is an amalgamated monstrosity of St Clewyd and Sallowbryg
Violet Harrowmoor is the missing daughter of Lady Harrowmoor
